newsitem.title: USA: Duke Power's -PanEnergy gets S.C. okay.
newsitem.headline: Duke Power's -PanEnergy gets S.C. okay.

text.p: Duke Power Co said on Wednesday its proposed $7.7 billion merger with PanEnergy Corp had received approval by regulators in South Carolina.
Duke Power said it signed a stipulation containing certain conditions, including one in which it agreed not to raise retail rates to customers through the year 2000.

However, the company said it may adjust rates with regulatory approval to reflect a "substantial impact" on the company, such as action by the government affecting the industry or major catastrophes, such as a storm, that causes substantial financial damage.
It said the stipulation does not include Duke Power's annual fuel clause adjustment, by which regulators modify rates slightly to accurately reflect fuel costs incurred by the company.
Hearings are also being held in Raleigh, N.C. regarding the merger, Duke Power said.
Besides South and North Carolina, other approvals needed for the merger include the Feeral Energy Regulatory Commission and shareholders of both company, Duke Power said.
